Talk_44:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm. There are a lot of dragon statues...
But we're looking for one with a long
body, sounds like.
What's with that mountain of death part?<sp:5:0:0>
That's...<sp:5:0:0>troubling.
Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Take a look! <sp:5:1:0>I think you'll be pretty
surprised by this discovery!
Talk_45:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>You found it? <sp:5:1:0>The place the monolith was
talking about?
Talk_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So that's where it was!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>Excellent work! <sp:5:1:0>I'll go and take a
look shortly.
Talk_32:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad>I take your restrained reaction to mean
you've never seen a Zonai relic before...<sp:5:0:0>
Allow me to explain.
Talk_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Though these ruins appear to be Zonai
in origin, they feature text written in
modern Hyrulean.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>How could that be? <sp:5:1:0>Who built these ruins
and for what purpose?
Talk_48:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I thought I could hear a loud noise from
deep within the ruins. <sp:5:1:0>You heard that
too, right?
Talk_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>There's my plucky assistant, getting to
work bright and early! <sp:5:1:0>I know I can count
on you to propel our research forward!
Talk_49:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Sad_01>That was unsettling. <sp:5:0:0>I wonder what might
have caused it.
Talk_35:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>There you are, my assistant! <sp:5:1:0>I know
I can count on you to propel our
research forward!
Talk_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_00>Hello, my brother in research! <sp:5:1:0>I was
waiting for you!
Talk_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>You're working late! <sp:5:0:0>Don't overdo it, OK?<sp:5:1:0>
I can't have my trusty assistant getting
worn out.
Talk_22:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's right!<sp:0:4:0>I'm the one who discovered these big
ruins way out here.<sp:0:4:0>But I wasn't able to make much progress
investigating them.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm only one Hylian, and this, alas, is not
a one-Hylian job.<sp:0:4:0>That's why I wrote to the Zonai Survey
Team asking them to dispatch a
researcher to assist me.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>And here you are, practically right after
I sent my letter! <sp:5:1:0>Great response time!
Talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><sp:1:1:4:0000a040>...What?<sp:5:1:0> You're not a Zonai Survey Team
researcher? You're just some guy?<sp:1:1:4:0000803f><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>I see...<sp:5:1:0>
Talk_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's just a guess, but...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I think of all the Zonai ruins that have
been found thus far, these might be the
most recent.
Talk_39:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The monoliths make mention of someone
called a sage. But who is that?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Hm... <sp:5:0:0>I think we can say with certainty
that they are connected somehow to
these ruins' creation.
Talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>So few people come through here, I
assumed you had to be the assistant
I asked for. <sp:5:1:0>My mistake.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Well, I haven't made any particularly
notable discoveries as of yet, so I can
investigate alone until I do.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But I'm certain that I'm on the brink of
brilliance!<sp:5:1:0> Come back soon so you don't
miss history being made.
Talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_00>Oops.<sp:5:1:0> Did you hear that?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>Sorry.<sp:5:1:0> Scrub that from your brain. It's not
meant to be public knowledge.
Talk_27:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>So few people come through here, I
assumed you had to be the assistant
I asked for. <sp:5:1:0>My mistake.
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>After all the trouble I've gone to...<sp:5:1:0> Can't they send
one assistant to help with my <clr:0000>monolith research<clr:ffff>?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_28:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>Hmm.<sp:5:1:0> I appreciate the offer, <sp:5:0:0>but that's
really not allowed.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Then again...<sp:5:1:0> Though he may not be a researcher,<sp:5:0:0>
he does have the look of an adventurer about him.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501>Maybe his expertise will get things back on track.<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:ffff>You know what? You're hired!<sp:5:1:0> For this
project alone, I'm appointing you as my
research assistant!
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Come on! <sp:5:0:0>Let's find out what secrets
these ruins are hiding!
Talk_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well then, we can dive right in.<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0>I'll start by showing you what my research
has uncovered so far. <sp:5:1:0>Wait there.
Talk_90:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm. It seems there's nothing more you
can help me with for now.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>I'll investigate alone for a while. Just
check back in when I inevitably make a
new discovery.<sp:5:1:0> I'm counting on you!
Talk_91:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If we're going to figure out the mystery of
these ruins, you need to know everything
we've uncovered thus far.
Talk_92:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey, partner! <sp:5:0:0>Thanks for coming.<sp:0:4:0>Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but
while I appreciate you checking on me,
I don't have any discoveries to report.
<snd:TalkPositive>I'll keep up the search though, so stop
by again, and maybe I'll have something
that needs your expertise.
Talk_93:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>I see! <sp:5:1:0>In other words...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>This ruin is dedicated to the sages who
fought with Rauru, the first king of Hyrule.<sp:5:0:0>
It was built by Hylians afterward!<sp:0:4:0>That explains why there was Hyrulean text
on the monoliths we found.
Talk_94:
I'm astonished to find so profound a
secret hidden in these long-buried ruins,
so full of mystery...
Talk_80:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm still searching the ruins, just in case
there are more monoliths to be found.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm a little low on assistant-requiring
work right now, but keep checking back
in case I find any more monoliths!
Talk_81:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey there, assistant! <sp:5:1:0>That monolith is
one of my newest discoveries.
Talk_82:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Huh?<sp:5:0:0> I'd hoped to give you something
as thanks, but...<sp:5:1:0>your pouch is too full
to hold it.
Talk_77_02: And this, too, as a bonus!
Talk_83:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Please do organize that pouch so I can
thank you. I have a <clr:0000>large Zonai charge
and a big battery with your name on them<clr:ffff>.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>
Oh, yes—<sp:5:0:0>and a <clr:0000>diamond <clr:ffff>too. Don't delay!
Talk_77_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>If you came all this way just to see
some ruins, <sp:5:0:0>you must be almost as
fanatical about Zonai history as I am!
So please, enjoy these Zonai artifacts
I discovered—<sp:5:0:0>mementos to remind you
of our time working together.
Talk_84:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It looks like you organized your pouch!<sp:5:0:0>
Well then, please take this.
Talk_70:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What? <sp:5:1:0>You already found the place the
monolith's talking about?
Talk_77_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Now, fear not. Since I'll be sticking
around a while, you can come back if
ever you'd like to talk ruins and relics.
In the meantime, happy trails!<sp:5:1:0> Goodbye,
my trusty assistant!
Talk_71:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is just a possibility, but the monoliths
that were found might be pointing to a
spot somewhere in the ruins.
You and me, we're going to get to
the bottom of this. I need you to find
that spot.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>There, we may find yet another monolith
that tells us why these ruins were built...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>It's just a hunch, but it's also your boss's
hunch. So...
Talk_86:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That loud noise coming from farther within
the ruins... <sp:5:0:0>What was that?
Talk_87:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey.<sp:5:0:0> There's nothing quite like ruins in
the rain, is there?
Talk_73:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Sorry to say, you won't find what you're
after around here. <sp:5:0:0>These ruins are from
an entirely different era.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>That said...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If you're that curious, you should pay
a visit to the Zonai Survey Team
headquarters in <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>.
They've chronicled every scrap of info
they've come across.<sp:5:0:0> If anyone can help
you find your ruins, it's them.
Talk_88:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Look at you, working through the rain!<sp:5:1:0>
I'm glad for your aid, assistant, <sp:5:0:0>but please
be mindful of your health.
Talk_74:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Kakariko Village is a Sheikah village
located east of Hyrule Field, north
of Dueling Peaks.
The Sheikah have always loved their
research, but these fresh Zonai ruins
really have the village hopping.
Talk_89:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>If there are any monoliths you haven't
investigated, don't be shy, assistant!
Get close, and take a good look.
Talk_75: <sp:3:0:2:0800>I hope you find what you're looking for!
Talk_60:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Oh, whoops.<sp:5:0:0> I completely forgot to give
you a reward...
Talk_61:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>If you were from the Zonai Survey Team,
I could tell you all about what I've
discovered so far. <sp:5:0:0>But you're not, so...
Talk_77:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I never could have solved the mysteries
of these ruins without you, my assistant.<sp:5:1:0>
You have my thanks!
Talk_78:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh,<sp:5:0:0> goodbye.


<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I could accomplish such great things with even one
adventure-ready assistant...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_63:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oh, yeah! <sp:5:1:0>I discovered a new monolith
while I was exploring the ruins.
Talk_79:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>I guess all I can do is wait around until they
send somebody...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_64:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's right over there.<sp:0:4:0>At a glance, it seems different from the
other monoliths. You should get closer
so you can see what it says.
Talk_66: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>Hm? What about the age of legends?
Talk_51:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Zonai were an ancient civilization
with their own system of writing. <sp:5:1:0>Almost
no one living today can read Zonai script.
But you can read the inscription on that
monolith, right? <sp:5:1:0>That's because it's
written in Hyrulean.
Talk_67:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'll stay here for now to analyze what's
written on this monolith.<sp:0:4:0>Once my heart rate returns to normal,
I'll swing by the survey-team base in
Kakariko and turn my findings into a book.
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>I can't wait to see the looks on their
faces!<sp:5:0:0> Ahaha!<sp:5:0:0> Oh, this is gonna be great!
Talk_68:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Now I see...<sp:5:0:0> You're looking for ruins from
the age of legends.
Talk_54:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hey.<sp:5:0:0> Isn't it a little late for you to be
poking around old ruins?
Talk_69:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice_00>Wait—<sp:5:0:0>you found another monolith?<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0>If it was hidden away down here, there's
almost certainly something important
written upon it!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Oh...<sp:5:1:0> My heart is pounding... Shall we
read it? Dare we?

<snd:Happy_00>We dare!<sp:5:0:0> Here, allow me!
Talk_40:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>My gut is telling me that there are four
of these monoliths total.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Which would mean that only one remains
to be found. <sp:5:1:0>We're on the brink of figuring
it all out! I know we are!
Talk_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>So this is what was waiting for us beneath
the ruins.
Talk_41:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The "owl," the "dragons"... <sp:5:1:0>Could those
be statues? There's one nearby that does
look like an owl.
Talk_42:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Two dragons"... <sp:5:0:0>That description reminds
me of something I saw when I first arrived
at these ruins.
Talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>There was a small ring of dragon-head
statues somewhere, wasn't there?<sp:5:0:0>
Ominous place...<sp:0:4:0>Where was that again?
Talk_58:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Rauru is named in legend as the first
king of Hyrule!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>And this mention of imprisoning the
Demon King...<sp:5:0:0> This monolith is no doubt
a chronicle of the Imprisoning War!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Painful_01>My heart won't stop pounding... <sp:5:1:0>Let's
read on!
